column1: If your mother, sister, or daughter was diagnosed with breast cancer, you have a higher risk.
This is a drug given to pregnant women between 1940 and 1971.
Women who took DES during pregnancy to prevent miscarriage have a slightly higher risk.
White women are diagnosed with breast cancer more often than African American/black, Hispanic/Latina, Asian/Pacific Islander, or American Indian/Alaska Native women.
You may want to avoid taking estrogen combined with progesterone or progestin.
It will lower estrogen in the body and can reduce your risk of breast cancer by as much as 50%.
Talk to your provider if you are interested in joining a clinical trial for breast cancer prevention.
